left.description: The pixel along the horizontal axis of the document/element that you want displayed in the upper left.

top.description: The pixel along the vertical axis of the document/element that you want displayed in the upper left.

behavior.description: Specifies whether the scrolling should animate smoothly, or happen instantly in a single jump.

description: Scrolls the window or element to a particular set of coordinates inside a given window or element.

examples.description: Scrolls [//div] element overflow by 1000 pixels from top.
Scrolls the page overflow by 1000 pixels from top.
Scrolls the page overflow by 100 pixels from top and 100 pixels from left.
Smoothly Scrolls the page overflow by 100 pixels from top and 100 pixels from left.
Smoothly Scrolls [//div] element overflow by 100 pixels from top and 100 pixels from left.

name: Scroll

properties.onElement: The locator value by which the element will be found.
properties.locator: The locator type by which the element will be found.
properties.argument: The coordinate to scroll to, along the y-axis (vertical), in pixels and the coordinate to scroll to, along the x-axis (horizontal), in pixels.

summary: Scrolls the window or element to a particular set of coordinates inside a given window or element.
